page.title: 06THE RIVER AND DOCKS
page.content: The docks were opened in 1963 and was opened by Sir William Worsley who was then a minister of state. 650 people work at the docks and the working hours are 2 o'clock till 10 and 6 o'clock till 2 o'clock. The biggest cargo was 5650 cars they also get timber, steel girders and alot more things. The size of the docks is about 7 football pitches, 303 ships can fit in at one time. The biggest ship weighs 165 thousand tons which was an oil tanker. Alot of the cargo comes from Australia,America, Brazil and Japan.The docks get 5000 ships a year and 2000 more come up and down the river. Some ships have to be painted bright so when the other ships see the ship coming they have to stop because the ship has explosives on board. Uniform depends on the cargo.
